channel.title: How do i get to the character files?
channel.description: I need help getting to the character files on ViacomX Thanks

item.title: How do i get to the character files?
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

Yeah it’s not that simple. And of course you’d have to log in and create a new save file by logging out so it can create a .txt. There’s usually more than one character.p to change, and don’t forget the loading.p method.

You’d be going the wrong way about it though if all you want to do is make yourself an admin. Just create a check for when you log in to set your rights to administrator. You will obviously have to do some research on method names before you know what to use.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i get to the character files?

item.title: How do i get to the character files?
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

I replied on your other thread. You can change the format that it saves in from .p to .txt (there’s a little bit more to it than that) but I can’t direct you in any helpful directions as I’m unfamiliar with the source.

item.title: How do i get to the character files?
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

Yeah, it’s encrypted and is meant to be like that. Probably so that the owner cannot read player’s passwords/faster access to the file.

item.source: How do i get to the character files?

item.title: How do i get to the character files?
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

I don’t know that server source, but I’d assume it’d be in a folder called savedGames or data/savedGames. Either that or your server doesn’t save and create a character file.

If you know where your saving method is, it will tell you in there. If your source has a Player or SaveGame class, check there.

Read full topic
